reviews.text: Hidden gem -- but likely not for long. Super laid back and no pretenses. Very friendly. Oh and yeah, their brews are delicious.
great beers and that's all that matters. funky industrial space with friendly people - and a focus on production. come check it out and see real deal micro/craft. these guys are living it.
Great find!  Good beer, people and space to enjoy yourself!

An amazing place to visit for a really good craft beer and friendly conversation with the staff. The brewmaster has a passion for his work, which is evident in care given to the beer and the hospitality show to the patrons. Visiting this bar, with it's open brewery, gave me a deeper sense of appreciation for beer.
Great brews and even better prices! I suggest the Sewer Alligator! The atmosphere leans more toward comfy and relaxed than night life, night out, but it's still a great time no matter what!
What a great spot. The beers are very unique and tasty. It's small, but has a real welcoming feel. So happy to have this place in my new neighborhood! I...

What can I say? Fantastic beers, place gets super-full and noisy, but you can still talk if you wander away from the bar over to where the brewing tanks are. Simple Pleasures: East IPA, straight from the tap at the brewery - delicious and refreshing. Also the Local 1 Belgian-style Golden Ale (which is almost too easy to drink, considering its whopping 9% alcohol content)

The beer is great. Good staples as choices and the quality and freshness was what you'd expect. Staff was friendly and quick. 

The big downside is the setup of this place: you wait in a line to get in, then wait in a line to get tokens, then wait in a line to exchange those tokens for beer. Could they have a more convoluted process? The tables and seating might as well not exist as the place is over-crowded and, as other reviewers note, full of drunk twenty-somethings. 

Bottom line: If you're a grumpy old person - prepare to be unhappy. If you're a drunk twenty-something - prepare to wait in line to get decent beer surrounded by your peers and frowning old(er) people.

We came in on the first warm Saturday of the year, around 4pm, which was way too late. The line was crazy long, and they sold out of tour tickets for the rest of the day, and the line to get tokens was too long and the line to get beer was long and... I don't know. I just didn't love it. 

Pros: Very cool space. 
Cons: It was overcrowded. And $5 for a plastic cup of beer is fine, I guess, but I wish they'd had more sample options (tastings of all the beers for like $20 or something).

We ended up talking our way onto the 4:30 tour by chance, which redeemed this trip - but I wouldn't count on that working again. The tour was pretty simple, the tour guide was cool and funny but it was pretty basic. Not sure I'd come back, honestly, or recommend it to anyone if they're not super into Brooklyn Brewery already.

I don't even like beer; came with some friends... I thought the place was pretty cool, and despite hating every beer I drink, the Yuka (fruit beer) was easily drinkable! Only negative is the seating availability. There's no place to sit; they could easily rearrange the place to maximize seating.

I used to love going to this place in the early 2000s. Now it's not as good. Gets super duper crowded with Millenials who seem to be getting drunk fit the first time. Fresh beer. Usually 4-5 choices. Get pizza delivered here. Don't think you'll get a table for happy hour if you show up after 6:30pm.

Amazing small batch tour!!!
Super interesting story about how tge brewery was created, amazing tasting beer and better guide/barman!
It is a must to come by!

I came to Chelsea last weekend with my friends and it was our second stop on our own personal brewery crawl. The owners  were extremely welcoming and told us about their history and how they just moved to the Bronx. I've been to a lot of breweries - and this was easily the most personal and best tour I've ever been given. The food is great - especially the beer cheese with the pretzels, and the beer is really tasty and different. I highly recommend it to anyone in NYC looking for a great experience and great beer. üëåüèº
Nice people great beer what more can I say oh yes a full kitchen with outstanding food come hungry ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩüòÄüòÄ
Beer is delicious and crisp. To get the best of the experience, I'd recommend a few flights of all the beer. Buffalo wings are juicy and tender.
Great craft beer, friendly staff. Definitely coming back!!
Awesome tap room, great food, and very friendly people at CCB
I visited the brewery with a cool social ride during Octoberfest. They are definitely bike friendly. They even had live music and corn hole. They have lots...
Love this place, some of the best beer being made in New York right now. Releases don't eat up your whole day and they generally have cans to pick up if you stop by.

Love the beers they make and that they go out of the comfort zone and make beers with ingredients you never thought would go well together. Facility was clean and open, not crowded when we went and had great service. Highly reccomend especially to hop heads
This place is incredible, they make amazing IPAs that are some of the best I've ever had. It's probably one of my top 3 breweries.

Disappointing experience after high expectations and a lot of hype going in.
Staff is not that friendly or knowledgeable. The beers are really overpriced (if you want a can, it's $7 on the spot!) considering you're at the source in the middle of nowhere Queens. Finback beers on tap in the city are the same price and even available on happy hour. They just offer absolutely no reason to make the trek there.

small and extremely high quality craft brewery in an odd little warehouse off the beaten track in queens. stark but comfortable tap room and chill place for a drink (or growler). definitely worth making the detour. make sure to check the hours though because they can vary.

#7 Rip harambe. Epic stout on tap. 

Posted an updated menu as of 7/16 

Support your local businesses,  Queens! 

You can spend less than 20 and try a wide...
Cool little place. Clean, nice layout for warmer weather (open garage style). Would be great if they had some bar snacks to pair with their beers.
Really like this spot. Great beers and a nice wide-open feel to the brewery makes it a perfect location for drinks with the crew. I think Higher Burnin' is one of the best beers I've ever had.
We enjoyed sampling the different beers here, especially the sour. Nice environment although its not overly large, staff was friendly and helpful.
Friendly staff, great rotating selection of fabulous Belgian style beers and the most relaxed atmosphere for a brewery in the area.
The beer ranges from decent to fantastic. The service, at its best, is only a notch above ambivalent. I will not return; however, I will happily order their beer at other venues.
I've been coming to LIC Beer Project sporadically for over a year now because it's conveniently located right near my gym (Brooklyn Boulders Queensbridge)...

Breweries.name: Other Half Brewing
Breweries.description: Craft Brewery specializing in IPA's and Sours

reviews.text: The scene of a Saturday morning can release is truly something to behold. Love these fellas. And considering their Gowanus Canal water supply, their product is impossibly delicious üòâ

I love this place. The staff is friendly, the beer is ridiculous, and the lines are never long for releases. The brewery is dog friendly and sells very cool merchandise. In addition, they have a local sandwich shop that posts up for their releases! You really can't beat the experience :)
Great little brewery, with an outdoor space. Very good beers, especially if you are an IPA fan. If you want to visit for a release, come early so you can get them before they sell out!
Great ipas. A lot of rotation with can releases every other Saturday. The tap room is on the small side, but nice - you're probably there for the beer anyways. Would recommend.

Fun, small place that serves some decent beer. Heavy on the IPA side, but of those they're awesome. Has a lot of collaboration beers and is active in the local beer scene. If you want to fill a growler make sure it's wide mouth or they can't fill it because of their system.

Quarters are tight, like, super-tight.

Beers are hoppy, like, super-hoppy.

If words like: Amarillo, Citra, Simcoe, and Mosaic hold meaning to you...you've...
If it's your first time, try one of the flights! Good beer. Fun atmosphere. Nice staff.

Local brewery. The Rockaway Brewing Company donates their used grain bags to the non-profit Surfrider Foundation NYC Chapter who use those bags for their beach cleanups. The RBC is a very community minded company. Check them out.

Pretty great beer, nice to have in a neighborhood like this!  The taproom is a bit smaller than I expected, so it may be a bit difficult to get a seat in the busier times, but it's a great brewery to visit.
Awesome welcoming tap room with friendly staff. Great selection of beer for all.

I love this kind of places. Simple, not crowded, laid back. Just serves beer, no food other than a few snacks. But they let you bring your own food. Beers are very good, and let you taste them so you can find the best that suits you very easily. Hope to visit them multiple times this summer

If you're only going to visit one of LIC's four (soon to be 5) breweries, THIS is the one you want to check out...

There's always a diverse selection of...

great brewery. very comfortable place where u can spread out a bit and enjoy delicious beers. very friendly and knowledgeable staff as well. get off at astoria ditmars subway stop and grab a $5 cab. easy.

Great low-key and fun location. Usually friendly service and pretty good beer. They've improved a lot since they first opened. 

They sometimes have live music and other events. There are some tasty snacks you can get here as well such as pretzels and bratwurst. 

They offer brewery tours on weekends and you can get growlers or crowlers to go here. Great prices all around.
I really like this place. Really chill. Good prices. Often change their beer selections.
Awesome beer selection, however location isn't that great. Plenty of parking around though.
Great beers.  Great guys with some awesome patience explaining what beer is what and the history of the said beers.  Will Definitely go again on my next trip to the City.
Great local beer for a great price. The seating area is very roomy and there is a selection of borad games to choose from as well. The best part is the $2-3...

Breweries.name: Sixpoint Brewery
Breweries.description: Sixpoint Craft Ales was founded in 2004 by Shane Welch, a former homebrewer that originally grew up in Milwaukee. The microbrewery is located in a 7,000-square-foot (650 m2) factory in in Red Hook, Brooklyn that formerly manufactured filing cabinets. Sixpoint began business by only distributing kegs to local bars and restaurants; instead of bottling its beer, filling growlers at bars were the only way for customers to drink the beer at their homes.

reviews.text: I'm a bartender and Resin is one of my go to beers, personally. I work at a high volume music club and the Sixpoint lineup consistently outperforms any other craft beers we have in house. I'd recommend this beer to any casual drinker, beer snob, or business owner looking to expand his craft beer menu.
The staff is awesome. There might be an attached brewpub soon, but not at the moment.

Disappointingly....not a tasting room, not open to the public, no phone number to confirm anything. How can a business not have a phone number?! Was looking forward to trying these beers fresh from the brewery ‚òπÔ∏è

I had a dish with roasted salmon that was absolutely delicious ! We were exhausted after walking up Broadway at going up the Empire State Building: this place was in a great location to just stop there and eat.
The best beer I've ever had! Jammer!
Sixpoint is hands down one of my favorite breweries.  Just about everything they do is exceptional.  love the Resin IIPA, Probably the best double out there...

Breweries.name: Strong Rope Brewery
Breweries.description: Strong Rope Brewery and taproom serves hand-crafted ales in Gowanus, Brooklyn. As a New York state Farm Brewery, Strong Rope's ales range from reinterpretations of classic styles to seasonal varieties that utilize the best ingredients local farms have to offer.

reviews.text: Tiny brewery.  Decent beer.  Not a lot of seating.  No Food, (yet?).

Strong Rope is your best friend's basement but 100 times better. It's a brewery that doubles as a cozy bar with some great tasting beer. They have sampler beers in 3oz, a 10oz size as well as a pint at 16oz. I really love the low-key vibe. You can stay as long as you want. Bring a bunch of people to relax and have good conversation.
Great microbrewery. Beers are well priced and it's got a nice calm atmosphere (I went there on a Saturday around 3). Good space.
Nice spot, they make some very nice beers but they don't do the hop bombs that other places do

This is a new and welcome addition to the neighborhood. I loved each beer I tried. It's a cool relaxed vibe and the bartenders are very helpful and friendly. They know all the ins and outs of their process and can give good recommendations. Ample room for seating and the crowd is friendly.
Freshest single best brew bar in Brooklyn right now. 3's has other brewery's on tap.. not here.. they make their ipas, strawberry beer and brown stouts...

Bronx Brewery hasn‚Äôt yet gained the fame and crowds of Brooklyn Brewing, but it seems poised to be the next breakout brewery. The setting is good for hanging out most of the day and it helps that the beer is pretty good. They do not serve food so bring something and make a picnic. They have about a dozen brews on tap of various styles and strength. The flagship Banner Ale and the Octoberfest were two of my favorites. They are even dog friendly at the outside section which is awesome. The outside is pretty big with a bunch of picnic tables while inside only has seating for a few folks. The only odd part is the layout where you have to walk through the brewery to get to the outside which can be a bit of a pain with a dog and stroller (if so inclined). It‚Äôs a good place to bring some food and hang out for the whole day while sampling their full range. It does get a bit crowded on weekend evenings these days.
Nice selection I  a tiny space. Snacks offered,  no hot food. Lots of IPA selections. No select parking lot for the space. Fun spot.
I went for a tour and tasting.  Well mostly for the tasting.  It was different to see different people in an area of the Bronx that was not so nice a short time ago.   The bartender was great.

Finally made it to this brewery, I have had a lot of Bronx Brewery American Pale Ales at different event and bars around New York City. It is great to see this destination brewery with my own eyes. Now, this area is an industrial location in the South Bronx.  Driving would be the best way to get here but our group of three decided to take the subway which is very doable with a ten minute walk from the 6 Train stop.

As you approach and enter this large industrial facility, there is tasting room to the left and straight ahead to go into the brewery. If you go through the brewery area, there is a large outdoor space. It's December now so it is definitely off-season for this outdoor location but I was told by the Brooklyn Brewery staff and tour guide, Kate that it is a great space on a summer weekend. They are food trucks and live music. I definitely need to come back and check it out.

They offer free tours of the brewery on the weekend. It was a quiet Sunday afternoon so we had a private tour because we were the only new arrivals at tour time. Kate explained very succinctly and efficiently the brewing process and more about Bronx Brewery. Bronx Brewery stated in 2011 but it only opened this brewery location in 2014 after a few years of renovation woes, thanks Hurricane Sandy.

If you check-in with Yelp, you get $1 off a pint after your tasting. We took advantage of this discount which was much appreciated. We decided to eat before we arrived but there is a good selection of small appetizer types of food such as prosciutto ($10), pretzels ($6) and toketti ($6). The toketti are Sardinian style flatbread chip-type munchies.

For the beer, we tried plenty of brews. We ended up with three different pints. The Rye Pale Ale was our first selection a crisp, golden-orange pale ale with rye and piney hops.  The other two selections were the seasonal brews, Winter and Bogsmash. The Winter Pale Ale is an amber colored pale ale brewed with cinnamon, molasses, cloves and ginger that has a spiced the flavor.  The Bogsmash Pale Ale is a fall brew with cranberries with a subtle tart aftertaste.

A few of my friends have personally recommended this location so I am happy to have made it to this location.

The Bronx Brewery is a great place to hang out with friends, drink a mellow local brew, and grab a bite to eat at the food truck in the back.  The summer ale is very delicious and just-right for the hot summer.  Once you get a beer, head to the outdoor seating area and listen to the live music on weekends.  Good for meeting friends and small groups.
My company had a work event here and it was tons of fun. They had tons of cans in ice tubs laying around. They had their two backyard taps open with beers I...

Small disclaimer, I'm not really much of a beer drinker. With that out of the way, what a delight. We have a craft brewery on the Island. Very easy to get to by train. Their beers are nice. I had the sampler. Like I stated, I'm not a beer person so I can't give you expert opinion on them. The space is really great. I haven't been here at peak hours. But in the weekday afternoon it's very chill. Nice place to hang out with friends. Wish there were more places like this around here.

When looking for beer one always needs to go for the freshest possible. That's why a brewery or brewpub is the choice. This is (so far) the only place on The Rock that fits that bill. Try the IPA. My fave.

They have excellent beer, check the calendar for local events. The trivia contests are really fun, and Fleet Week 2016 had a great outdoor music festival by the Staten Island Ferry. Community style seating, you can even order food from other local restaurants. The merchandise is cool, too.

The beer here is pretty good, but the atmosphere is AMAZING.

Big ole stage for live music. And there's a ton of room to feel comfortable and hang out. The guys working the taps are great and friendly and happy to chat with you about beer.

I hope that they start getting a little more daring with their brews at some point, but they are still young, so they definitely have time to evolve!
Awesome beer and super friendly staff. Best brewery in nyc!
In my opinion some of the best beer in the city this place is the best fresh clean amazing tasting beer from the island thank you for making such a quality...

Breweries.name: Threes Brewing
Breweries.description: Threes Brewing is a brewery, bar & event space located in Gowanus, Brooklyn. Open 7 days a week with food, drink and programming, check back regularly for updates. We have a rotating kitchen residency where we bring in our favorite restaurants to take over our kitchen for a few weeks at a time.

reviews.text: Decent Beers. Friendly Staff. Nice Atmosphere (Very Hipster). The Meat Hook provides the food, super expensive.  They claim an amazing burger (They lie). They failed to cook burger Med-Rare ($13 for 1/3 lb cheese burger). Overall very disappointed!!!

The beer here is very good. I didn't have the food, but it smells amazing and everyone is eating something ,  so it must be good. Kinda feels like your in a restaurant and not a brewery. Plus, the Outdoor area is nice too.

Excellent selection of Three's made beer, as well as cans and bottles from other sought after Brooklyn breweries. Outdoor patio is a nice plus, although on a 65 degree night they needed to turn off the heat lamps. Prices are about average, and the service was good but not great.

Excellent experience. Persuaded my girlfriend to pop in for a final drink before our flight back to the UK and it ended up being 3 and food. Lovely guys behind the bar, exciting food, music that will suit most tastes, and an excellent choice of beers: 20 of their own, 8 guests. Highly recommended to make any effort to get here.
Threes has very good beers and good food. They have a nice big backyard with lots of tables and space to spread out. It's a nice place for a Sunday fun day.
There's a whole lot more beer to be had in Brooklyn beyond that burrow-named brewery. For starters, there's this awesome little/big spot filled with stellar...
Cool brewery. Off the beaten path. Only bottles their beer which makes it difficult to enjoy just a selection for a true tasting

If you love beer, you need to go here. 

Transmitter brews truly delicious beers (such as my favorite stout and one of the best triples I've ever had). Everything is bomber style, but the beers aren't too high gravity. Very rich, complex, nuanced flavors. Wide variety of brew types, all great. Make sure you pour with a little head, because every beer has a delicious one. But, those are just their beers, which you can get in a few places. 

The tasting session at the brewery itself is amazing. You're literally tucked away in a corner of the brewery at small makeshift tables. The kegs and brew instruments are right there. So it smells like beer being made and you can watch them close out their day and see how they brew. They're more than willing to talk about the brews and they all have a great passion for brewing. It ends up being an amazing experience for a beer lover. Can't recommend enough. 

Love the brew dog too!

Good albeit VERY small tasting room. They do bottle conditioned beers so they'll have a few open for free tasting. If you like one then you can buy a bottle and drink in the tasting room. Everyone there is really nice and friendly and the prices are good too, especially given everything is bottled.
Great spot off the beaten path to enjoy a sour. No taps but plenty of well-executed and bottle conditioned farmhouse ales ready to taste. It's like a Belgium picnic between fermenters.
Cosy little brew bar, with a tasty range of sours & wilds üëåüèª

If you're a farmhouse/saison fan, Transmitter Brewing is your spot!

The brewery itself is quite small with a few benches, but once you you walk in, you get...
